content:
The Michael Langsam Family of Inwald


From: Langsam Jacob <qcjack@ecitele.com> 
To: "'moishe@langsam.com'"  
Subject: The Langsam Family 
Date: 17 Jan 2000 07:04:

Thanks!
We were in contact in the past.
I didn't succeed to locate my family brunch in yours because I don't have
full names and birth cities of my family (no written records due to W.W.II).
It is nice to have an Langsam.com in our world (seen it once somewhere)

Jacob (Yaakov) Langsam 
_____________________________________________________________________  

Date: Sat, 29 Jan 2000 20:28:26 -0500
To: Langsam Jacob <qcjack@ecitele.com>
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: RE: The Langsam Family

Hi, 
I know that we have. I was hoping maybe you had more. Anyhow, would it be possible 
to re-tell what you know please? I have found many more branches in the last couple 
of years and might be able to "hang" yours. I connected two earlier today. 
Also, what is your connection to Rama Dunayevich? 
Many thanks for your indulgence.
-Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com
www.langsam.com
_____________________________________________________________________  
From: Langsam Jacob <qcjack@ecitele.com> 
To: "'moishe@langsam.com'"  
Subject: RE: The Langsam Family 
Date: Mon, 31 Jan 2000 06:49:42 +0200 
X-Mailer: Internet Mail Service (5.5.2448.0) 


Sorry ,I didn't replied earlier.


I don't have former correspondence because I clear it from time to time.
I shall write you details about my family as soon as I have internet
connection at home 
_____________________________________________________________________  
From: Langsam Jacob <qcjack@ecitele.com> 
To: "'moishe@langsam.com'"  
Subject: RE: The Langsam Family 
Date: Thu, 22 Jun 2000 07:06:56 +0300 
X-Mailer: Internet Mail Service (5.5.2650.21) 


Hello there !


I am still connected (same E-mail).


My previous trials to locate any connections in your site, didn't succeed.
I know that my father's uncle went to USA before W.W.I (1913).


I visit Langsam site from time to time.


Thanks
Langsam Jacob


Israel
_____________________________________________________________________  
Date: Fri, 23 Jun 2000 02:13:23 -0700
To: Langsam Jacob <qcjack@ecitele.com>
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: RE: The Langsam Family

Hi,
Thanks for your response! I have unpublished material and would really appreciate 
any cooperation you could give. It might help put more of the tree together. Would 
you mind terribly telling me a little about your ancestry? Where they were from in 
Europe? Who was the earliest known Langsam in your branch? When did they live?
Thanks so much for any consideration you can give this,
-Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com


PS: 
Who was your father's uncle?
_____________________________________________________________________  
From: Langsam Jacob <qcjack@ecitele.com> 
To: "'moishe@langsam.com'"  
Subject:  The Langsam Family-Thanks very much 
Date: Tue, 17 Jul 2001 07:11:55 +0300 
X-Mailer: Internet Mail Service (5.5.2650.21) 


I know not very much (because my father was young that time) 

The few that I know 
Michael Langsam 1834 - 1938 (INVALD- POLLAND) 
  4 sons Aharon                     (went to USA in about 1910)-Can't find him ???? 
            Yosef                        (lived in Ches) 
            Moris 
            Yakov     1878- WWII (ziwies,Zaibush- POLLAND), My grandfather 

_____________________________________________________________________  
Date: Tue, 17 Jul 2001 02:22:11 -0400
To: Langsam Jacob <qcjack@ecitele.com>
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: Re: The Langsam Family-Thanks very much 

Hi,
Thanks for the reply, but still nothing clear that I see.

Do you know anything about Moris? Do you have ANY Langsam cousins here in the USA?

-Moishe
_____________________________________________________________________  
From: Langsam Jacob <qcjack@ecitele.com> 
To: "'moishe@langsam.com'"  
Subject: RE: The Langsam Family-Thanks very much 
Date: Tue, 17 Jul 2001 09:38:09 +0300 
X-Mailer: Internet Mail Service (5.5.2650.21) 


Awake at such an hour   ? 

Sorry ! No more data of any kind. 
I do not have any connections or family in the states. 

Anyway thanks for your willingness and keep in touch. 



   Jacob Langsam 

_____________________________________________________________________  
Date: Wed, 14 Nov 2001 22:03:37 -0500
To: Langsam Jacob <qcjack@ecitele.com>
From: "moishe@langsam.com" 
Subject: RE: The Langsam Family

Hi,
I have been using the Ellis Island Database to find out more details about the various Langsam 
branches. Can you tell me a little more about your own grandfather Yakov. Who did he marry? Who 
were his children? 
Also, aside from this grandfather's children. Do you know of ANY other Langsam relatives anywhere 
in the world?
Thanks!
-Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com
_____________________________________________________________________


I would be very interested to hear from anyone with knowledge or an interest in the Miller family.

Moishe Miller
moishe@langsam.com

My home address is
           1374 East 28th Street
           Brooklyn NY 11210-5311
           USA

Last updated 11/14/01
